lines.name: Locke
lines.text: (Alright, maybe if I move in a more of a zig-zag pattern...)

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: (The Cheepskate will never see what hit him!)
WEE WOO WEE WOO. (idk insert siren sounds here)

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: Oh no. Are those sirens I hear? Don't tell me SHE'S one duty today!

lines.name: Lynn
lines.text: ALRIGHT. HANDS UP WHERE I CAN SEE 'EM.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: That's... a bit hard right now.

lines.name: Lynn
lines.text: That voice... YOU again. Locke, what in God's name are you doing.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: AHH! this is a professional investigation, please don't question my methods!

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: Uhhhm... This isn't what it looks like?

lines.name: Lynn
lines.text: It looks like you're walking through a crime scene with a trash can over your head.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: Ah, very perceptive. Okay so it's exactly what it looks like! But there's a very good reason for it!

lines.name: Lynn
lines.text: A good reason for tampering with potential evidence?

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: EXAMINING potential evidence!

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: You see, I believe my client lost something very precious around here.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: The way I see it, the prepetrator might have disposed of some telltale clues in the trash. And once they decided to do that, the clues BECAME trash and entire the domain...

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: OF THE TRASH CAN!

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: Therefore, if I can embody the spirit of the trash can and think like the trash can, then maybe...

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: I can figure out what happened to the item!

lines.name: Lynn
lines.text: Locke, get yourself out of the trash can.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: But if the perp comes back, they won't recognize that I'm a detective. They'll think I'm just a trash can!

lines.name: Lynn
lines.text: Are you sure you didn't just trip and fall into a trash can?

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: ...I tripped and fell into a trash can.

lines.name: Lynn
lines.text: Get out of the trash can.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: Alright alright!

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: Hold on, this is actually harder than it looks.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: There. Trash-free. You know, I'll miss that trash can. We had good times togeth-

lines.name: Lynn
lines.text: Locke, this is the second time I've caught you mucking around a crime scene.

lines.name: Lynn
lines.text: Who knows what damage you could have done if Keyna hadn't told me where to find you!

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: Keyna told you? Don't tell me this is revenge for-

lines.name: Lynn
lines.text: Revenge for what.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: Oh nothing! Just uhh, a light-hearted prank war, that's all!

lines.name: Lynn
lines.text: ...Uh huh. As I was saying, this is strike two.

lines.name: Lynn
lines.text: If I catch you stomping around again, I'll have to take you down to the station.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: If you catch me, you say?

lines.name: Lynn
lines.text: Locke.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: Right, I got it! I'll try not to get in the way of police business again!

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: We can pinky promise on it.

lines.name: Lynn
lines.text: I'm not touching your garbage-encrusted pinky.
Lynn storms away. (idk is it ok to just say she storms away?)

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: Well, she didn't pinky promise on it AND I didn't get arrested.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: I consider this operation a success!

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: Oh hey, how'd this ring get here?
--Back at the agency--

lines.name: Earl Leebird
lines.text: I can't believe you found the ring!

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: Yeah well, you might want to give it a wash.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: I tracked the Cheepskate to an alleyway by the bakery.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: And apparently, he got caught up in a turf war and stash the ring in the trash for safekeeping.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: ...The same alleyway where a major crime scene investigation happened to be taking place.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: Luckily, I stealthed my way out of trouble with the cops.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: Anyways, if you could deposit my reward please.

lines.name: Earl Leebird
lines.text: Oh, uh. Ok, I wasn't sure if you liked chocolate so I decided to play it safe with a fruit tart.

lines.name: Earl Leebird
lines.text: You can't go wrong with fruit tarts! Especially if it's from the bakery down the street.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: ...If you can afford a $5000 ring, I think you can afford more than a fruit tart.

lines.name: Earl Leebird
lines.text: Afford? Oh no no no, I'm just a simple salaryman.

lines.name: Earl Leebird
lines.text: See, this was a parting gift from my husband, Cottin D'wirm before he went on a business trip to Germany.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: (He married up!)

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: Well not a problem, helping others is a reward in itself. But let your husband know that if he ever needs some detective-ing done, Enloade Detective Agency is where it's at.

lines.name: Earl Leebird
lines.text: Actually he's a frequent visitor of Open and Shut Case Investigations. I never knew there was another agency right across until recently.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: What! Listen, I was here first-

lines.name: Earl Leebird
lines.text: Anyways, I must be going now. Thank you very much for the ring!

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: So if I eat one strawberry from the tart a day, I think this can last me a week.

lines.name: Locke
lines.text: It's a good thing I also found a fully wrapped hamburger in the trash can earlier...
